net.proteusframework.cms.dao

Class PageElementPathDAO

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.core.hibernate.dao.DAOHelper
      • net.proteusframework.cms.dao.PageElementPathDAO
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean

    @Repository(value="cmsPageElementPathManager")
public class PageElementPathDAO
extends net.proteusframework.core.hibernate.dao.DAOHelper
    DAO for managing request paths and related actions. This is used exclusively by the backend code.
    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@proteus.co)

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Method Detail

      • createPageElementPathMapping

        public PageElementPath createPageElementPathMapping(PageElement element,
                                                    java.lang.String path)
                                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create a request path for the Page Element at the requested path The page element must be an attached entity.
        Parameters:
        element - The target of the request path
        path - The path string
        Returns:
        the newly-created PageElementPath
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the PageElement or path is null

      • createPageElementPathMapping

        public PageElementPath createPageElementPathMapping(PageElement element,
                                                    java.lang.String path,
                                                    boolean wildcard)
                                             throws CmsValidationException
        Create a request path for the Page Element at the requested path
        Parameters:
        element - The target of the request path. May not be null.
        path - The path string. Must be unique for the site.
        wildcard - Whether the path supports wildcard paths.
        Returns:
        the newly-created PageElementPath
        Throws:
        CmsValidationException - if the PageElement or path is null or the PageElement is trashed.

      • deletePageElementPath

        public void deletePageElementPath(PageElementPath rp,
                                  boolean automaticallyClearPrimaryPath)
        Delete a PageElementPath.
        Parameters:
        rp - the request path.
        automaticallyClearPrimaryPath - flag to auto clear a primary path if one exists for this PageElementPath.

      • getPageElementPathForExactPath

        public PageElementPath getPageElementPathForExactPath(java.lang.String pePath,
                                                      net.proteusframework.internet.http.Site site)
        Return the PageElementPath that matches the passed string exactly. Does not consider the wildcard property. Note that this method is safe for validation of an existing request path, as it overrides the default flush mode and does not trigger a flush when getting the results of the query.
        Parameters:
        pePath - the path to query on.
        site - the site associated with the request.
        Returns:
        the matching PageElementPath or null if there is no match.

      • getPageElementPathLastModTime

        public java.util.Date getPageElementPathLastModTime(net.proteusframework.internet.http.Site site)
        Get the request path last mod time for a site.
        Parameters:
        site - the site.
        Returns:
        the last mod time.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a list of the paths for the element.

        peCollection - the page element collection. This collection should be of the same type.
        Returns:
        a list of the paths for the element.

      • getSinglePageElementPath

        public @Nullable PageElementPath getSinglePageElementPath(@Nullable PageElement pageElement)
        Get a single request path from all paths mapped to the specified element.

        Returns the primary request path if set; otherwise a query is performed and the first path is returned.

        Parameters:
        pageElement - the page element. May be null.
        Returns:
        the path or null if none found.

      • isPathAvailable

        public boolean isPathAvailable(java.lang.String pePath,
                               net.proteusframework.internet.http.Site site)
        Returns true if there is no existing PageElementPath for the passed path or false if a PageElementPath already exists.
        Parameters:
        pePath - the path to test.
        site - the site to check.
        Returns:
        true if the path is available, else false.

      • isSubpath

        public boolean isSubpath(PageElement superElement,
                         PageElement subElement,
                         boolean strictSubPath)
        Check if the specified element is the matching path of another.
        Example:
        superElement -> "/company/news"
        subElement -> "/company/news/article"
        Returns true
        Parameters:
        superElement - the super element.
        subElement - the sub element.
        strictSubPath - flag to determine if check is strict subpath or matching string.
        Returns:
        true or false.

      • normalizePath

        Parameters:
        path - the path.
        Returns:
        the normalized path.

                                  net.proteusframework.internet.http.Site site)
        Rename the paths under the old path to be under the new path.
        Parameters:
        oldpath - the old path
        newpath - the new path
        site - the site.
        Returns:
        the number of paths that were updated.

                                                                                                           boolean checkExisting)
        Return whether the passed path string is a valid request path.
        Parameters:
